item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 29, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Accessible open textbooks in math-heavy disciplines (54 points | 13 comments)
2. Show HN: Physical Pomodoro Timer with ESP32 and e-paper screen (226 points | 52 comments)
3. Vramfs: Vram Based Filesystem for Linux (4 points | discuss)
4. Veloren – voxel action-adventure role-playing in Rust (3 points | discuss)
5. Real Time Chess – A physical chess board without the concept of turns (86 points | 12 comments)
6. Huge Structures Discovered Under Pyramids? (8 points | discuss)
7. Plain – a web framework for building products with Python (236 points | 134 comments)
8. We hacked Gemini's Python sandbox and leaked its source code (at least some) (601 points | 125 comments)
9. Low responsiveness of ML models to critical or deteriorating health conditions (63 points | 31 comments)
10. Koto Programming Language (110 points | 88 comments)
11. Chimpanzees act as 'engineers', choosing materials to make tools (77 points | 57 comments)
12. Mathematical Compact Models of Advanced Transistors [pdf] (67 points | 15 comments)
13. Twitter (X) Hit by Data Leak of 2.8B Users – Allegedly an Insider Job (19 points | 3 comments)
14. Show HN: Bknd – Firebase alternative that embeds into any React stack (33 points | 14 comments)
15. Playstation Mod Turns the PSOne into a Crustacean (90 points | 20 comments)
16. The Matrix Calculus You Need for Deep Learning (49 points | 1 comment)
17. Rubik's Cube Solutions, Puzzles, and 8-Balls (2023) (9 points | 1 comment)
18. Show HN Pianoboi – displays sheet music as you play your piano (85 points | 20 comments)
19. Beyond Bohr and Einstein (22 points | 2 comments)
20. Typed Japanese (7 points | discuss)
21. Digital Echoes and Unquiet Minds (154 points | 74 comments)
22. Caido – A lightweight web security auditing toolkit (15 points | 1 comment)
23. Et Tu, Grammarly? (230 points | 54 comments)
24. Optimizing Matrix Multiplication on RDNA3 (111 points | 22 comments)
25. Around the World, Many People Are Leaving Their Childhood Religions (12 points | 5 comments)
26. Decomposing a Factorial into Large Factors (123 points | 25 comments)
27. Why I'm No Longer Talking to Architects About Microservices (84 points | 54 comments)
28. Show HN: Hexi – Modern header-only network binary serialisation for C++ (106 points | 38 comments)
29. xAI has acquired X, xAI now valued at $80B (723 points | 1063 comments)
30. How to write blog posts that developers read (529 points | 148 comments)
